result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aiden A. Montgomery

records.addlTxt: 21CF255 & 22CF62 Cases called @ 9:48 AM Defendant Aiden A Montgomery in court.  Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd in court for Aiden A Montgomery. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 21CF255: Cts 2 & 3 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 21CF255 Ct 1- DRI. 22CF62 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 18 mos Probation - Conditions: Defendant must obtain HSED or GED. AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, Maintain full time employment or attend course of study on a full-time basis. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP,  DNA Sample and Surcharge. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given. Bond poster in 22CF62 present in court - no objection to bond being applied to case 21CF255. Court orders bond in case 22CF62 be applied to costs in case 21CF255.
Defendent's Response to States Discovery Demand

22CF62 & 21CF255 Cases called @ 3:28 PM Defendant Aiden A. Montgomery in court.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd in court for Aiden A. Montgomery. 22CF62 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived.  NGP entered.  Atty Lloyd requests a P/S hearing on both cases. P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on March 29, 2022 at 03:10 pm.
Defendants Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant must attend school without any truancy or unexcused absences.

Case called @ 1:17 PM Defendant Aiden A. Montgomery in custody, appeared by video with Attorney Emma K Blankschein. Attorney Wesley Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $2000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State
Initial appearance scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
